body: I think you're actually running v0.12.9, and that looks like a genuine bug.

rename.from: Version 0.10.29 Windows: panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
rename.to: Version 0.12.9 Windows: panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference

body:
u're correct with my typo in the version and the dealbreaker :-)
corrected the typo.

Can you test the build from here, please:

http://build.syncthing.net/job/syncthing-pr/1374/
Possibly it may still exit with a fatal error, but in that case I want to know what it is

Thank you!
I downloaded syncthing-windows-amd64-v0.12.9+3-g2fde621.zip and the result is:
C:\syncthing-windows-amd64>syncthing.exe
08:54:41 FATAL: Lstat : Das System kann den angegebenen Pfad nicht finden.

means, cannot find the path

That's really weird. Your config directory, does it exist? Do you have any symlinks or weird windows junctions or whatever involved? I'll make a build to avoid the error, but I'm not sure why it happens in the first place. :)

See what happens with this one?

http://build.syncthing.net/job/syncthing-pr/1375/

That seems to work:
`C:\syncthing-windows-amd64>syncthing.exe`
`[monitor] 10:38:06 INFO: Log output saved to file "${config}/syncthing.log"`
`[monitor] 10:38:06 INFO: Starting syncthing`
`[FNH3H] 10:38:07 INFO: syncthing v0.12.9+3-g0347036 "Beryllium Bedbug" (go1.5.2 windows-amd64) unknown-user@build2.syncthing.net 2015-12-21 08:35:50 UTC`
`[FNH3H] 10:38:07 INFO: My ID: foo`
`[FNH3H] 10:38:07 INFO: Single thread hash performance is ~152 MB/s`

"Your config directory, does it exist? Do you have any symlinks or weird windows junctions or whatever involved?"
Yes, it exists, _and_ I have a Symlink created on 
C:\Users\user\AppData\Local\Syncthing pointing to a drive which has a lot of space, because the left space on C:\ will not suffice with the space needed by the database. Its more than 50GB at some time, so I had to move it, because I did not found a way to change the database path in the config and drive C:\ went full.

Is there a userfriendly way to specify another path for the database, btw?

Also, I recognized, that no logfile is written to the disk anymore, as stated here:
`[monitor] 10:38:06 INFO: Log output saved to file "${config}/syncthing.log"`
Only output to the DOS Window, which is ok by now.

> Is there a userfriendly way to specify another path for the database, btw?

Yes, run `syncthing.exe -home C:\Some\Path`. Running `syncthing.exe -help` will describe all of the options available to you.

> Log output saved to file "${config}/syncthing.log"

This is broken. I think this is something that has gone wrong in the recent refactorings

> I have a Symlink created on  C:\Users\user\AppData\Local\Syncthing pointing to a drive which has a lot of space

This is probably the other root cause.

> This is probably the other root cause.

I copied the whole content of the symlinks folder to C:\Users\user\AppData\Local\Syncthing\ and started the old and not working version to verify that:

`C:\syncthing-windows-amd64>syncthing.exe`
`[monitor] 11:53:52 INFO: Log output saved to file "${config}/syncthing.log"`
`[monitor] 11:53:53 INFO: Starting syncthing`
`[FNH3H] 11:53:53 INFO: syncthing v0.12.9 "Beryllium Bedbug" (go1.6beta1 windows-amd64) SYNCTHING\admin@builder-w2k12r2 2015-12-20 09:05:17 UTC`
`[FNH3H] 11:53:53 INFO: My ID: foo`
`[FNH3H] 11:53:53 INFO: Single thread hash performance is ~153 MB/s`

Then, I changed it back to the symlink and it did not worked, giving the same error as above.

_So that was the cause_.

Thank you for pointing that out, though its a pitty and annoyance at the same time, because it tells me, I cannot trust symlinks on a Windows7 System... (all other symlinks I've ever used worked as expected...)

I'll take the advice from @canton7 and will modify my syncthing-start.bat to something like `@start "Syncthing" /low syncthing.exe -no-console -no-browser -home="X:\path\to\more\wisdom_and_space"`

Thank you both.
